verses.verse: Prayer for Deliverance from Enemies (Psalms 9-10 were originally one psalm, as in the Greek and Latin traditions. In Hebrew, Psalms 9-10 formed an acrostic.) Why, O LORD, do you stand far off? Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
(Ps 7.15; 9.16; 109.16) In arrogance the wicked persecute the poor— let them be caught in the schemes they have devised.
(v 13|PSA 10:13; Job 1.5, 11; Ps 94.4) For the wicked boast of the desires of their heart; those greedy for gain curse and renounce the LORD.
(v 13|PSA 10:13; Ps 14.1) In the pride of their countenance the wicked say, “God will not seek it out”; all their thoughts are, “There is no God.”
Their ways prosper at all times; your judgments are on high, out of their sight; as for their foes, they scoff at them.
(Ps 30.6; 49.11) They think in their heart, “We shall not be moved; throughout all generations we shall not meet adversity.”
(Ps 59.12; 73.8; 140.3; Rom 3.14) Their mouths are filled with cursing and deceit and oppression; under their tongues are mischief and iniquity.
(Ps 94.6; Prov 1.11) They sit in ambush in the villages; in hiding places they murder the innocent. Their eyes stealthily watch for the helpless;
(v 2|PSA 10:2; Ps 17.12; 59.3; 140.5) they lurk in secret like a lion in its den; they lurk that they may seize the poor; they seize the poor and drag them off in their net.
They stoop, they crouch, and the helpless fall by their might.
(v 4|PSA 10:4; Job 22.13; Ps 73.11) They think in their heart, “God has forgotten; he has hidden his face; he will never see it.”
(Ps 9.12; Mic 5.9) Rise up, O LORD; O God, lift up your hand; do not forget the oppressed.
Why do the wicked renounce God and say in their hearts, “You will not call us to account”?

(Job 11.11; Ps 37.5; 68.5; Jer 51.56; Hos 14.3) But you do see! Indeed, you note trouble and grief, that you may take it into your hands; the helpless commit themselves to you; you have been the helper of the orphan.
(Ps 9.12; 37.17) Break the arm of the wicked and evildoers; seek out their wickedness until you find none.
(Deut 8.20; Ps 29.10) The LORD is king forever and ever; the nations shall perish from his land.
(1 Chr 29.18; Ps 34.15; 145.19) O LORD, you will hear the desire of the meek; you will strengthen their heart; you will incline your ear
(Ps 9.9; 82.3; Isa 29.20) to do justice for the orphan and the oppressed, so that those from earth may strike terror no more. (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
